Class GameArena

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
GameArena
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GameArena
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
This class provides a simple window in which grahical objects can be drawn.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • GameArena

      public GameArena​(int width, int height)
      Create a view of a GameArena.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the playing area, in pixels.
      height - The height of the playing area, in pixels.

    • GameArena

      public GameArena​(int width, int height, boolean createWindow)
      Create a view of a GameArena.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the playing area, in pixels.
      height - The height of the playing area, in pixels.
      createWindow - Defines if a window should be created to host this GameArena. @see getPanel.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • setSize

      public void setSize​(int width, int height)
      Update the size of the GameArena.
      Overrides:
      setSize in class java.awt.Component
      Parameters:
      width - the new width of the window in pixels.
      height - the new height of the window in pixels.

    • setBackgroundImage

      public void setBackgroundImage​(java.lang.String filename)
      Set the background of the GameArena window to the specified image file. The image will be scaled to fit the size of the GameArena
      Parameters:
      filename - the filename of an image to use.

    • getPanel

      public javax.swing.JPanel getPanel()
      Retrieves the JPanel on which this gameArena is drawn, so that it can be integrated into a users application. n.b. This should only be called if this GameArena was constructed without its own JFrame
      Returns:
      the JPanel containing this GameArena.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Close this GameArena window.

    • paint

      public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics gr)
      A method called by the operating system to draw onto the screen -

      YOU DO NOT (AND SHOULD NOT) NEED TO CALL THIS METHOD.

      Overrides:
      paint in class javax.swing.JComponent

    • addBall

      public void addBall​(Ball b)
      Adds a given Ball to the GameArena. Once a Ball is added, it will automatically appear on the window.
      Parameters:
      b - the ball to add to the GameArena.

    • addRectangle

      public void addRectangle​(Rectangle r)
      Adds a given Rectangle to the GameArena. Once a rectangle is added, it will automatically appear on the window.
      Parameters:
      r - the rectangle to add to the GameArena.

    • addLine

      public void addLine​(Line l)
      Adds a given Line to the GameArena. Once a Line is added, it will automatically appear on the window.
      Parameters:
      l - the line to add to the GameArena.

    • addText

      public void addText​(Text t)
      Adds a given Text object to the GameArena. Once a Text object is added, it will automatically appear on the window.
      Parameters:
      t - the text object to add to the GameArena.

    • removeRectangle

      public void removeRectangle​(Rectangle r)
      Remove a Rectangle from the GameArena. Once a Rectangle is removed, it will no longer appear on the window.
      Parameters:
      r - the rectangle to remove from the GameArena.

    • removeBall

      public void removeBall​(Ball b)
      Remove a Ball from the GameArena. Once a Ball is removed, it will no longer appear on the window.
      Parameters:
      b - the ball to remove from the GameArena.

    • removeLine

      public void removeLine​(Line l)
      Remove a Line from the GameArena. Once a Line is removed, it will no longer appear on the window.
      Parameters:
      l - the line to remove from the GameArena.

    • removeText

      public void removeText​(Text t)
      Remove a Text object from the GameArena. Once a Text object is removed, it will no longer appear on the window.
      Parameters:
      t - the text object to remove from the GameArena.

    • clearGameArena

      public void clearGameArena()
      Removes every object that has ever been added to the GameArena. Nothing should appear on the GameArena window after this has executed.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pause for a 1/50 of a second. This method causes your program to delay for 1/50th of a second. You'll find this useful if you're trying to animate your application.

    • letterPressed

      public boolean letterPressed​(char key)
      Check if an ASCII A-Z or a-z letter key has been pressed.
      Parameters:
      key - the ASCII A-Z or a-z char to check if it has been pressed.
      Returns:
      whether or not that char has been pressed.
